Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer's decision to reject the applicant's claim of risk upon return to South Korea was reasonable and procedurally fair
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution in South Korea due to discrimination and threats; key incidents from 2009 were central to the claim
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review granted; matter referred back for redetermination
Court_Ruling: Procedural unfairness found; unreasonable state protection analysis; new assessment ordered
Defendant_Behavior: PRRA officer failed to address key evidence and made veiled credibility determination without oral hearing
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution upon return to South Korea based on past discrimination and threats
Legal_Standard: Correctness standard for procedural fairness; reasonableness standard for evidence treatment and state protection analysis
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, state protection, procedural fairness, completeness of risk assessment
Procedural_Issue: Lack of oral hearing despite credibility concerns; inadequate consideration of relevant evidence
Review_Standard: Correctness for procedural fairness; reasonableness for evidentiary and state protection analysis
Credibility_Assessment: Veiled credibility determination made without opportunity for oral hearing
Evidence_Used: Incidents from 2009, applicantâ€™s personal experiences of discrimination and threats
Application_Basis: Personal risk due to immigration-related persecution in country of origin
Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient assessment of 2009 incidents; incomplete state protection analysis
Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must consider all relevant evidence and provide oral hearings if credibility is at issue
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to adequately address key incidents from 2009
Outcome: Judicial review granted; case remitted for new assessment
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution upon return to South Korea
Cause_Description: Applicant faced discrimination and threats in South Korea; claim not properly assessed by PRRA officer
Evidence_Handling: Inadequate consideration of central evidence; lack of transparency in credibility findings
Evidence_Issues: Missing oral hearing, incomplete evaluation of evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Unreasonable due to omissions in key factual analysis
Decision_Rationale: Procedural unfairness and flawed state protection analysis undermined decision integrity
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address central incidents; lack of oral hearing when credibility was in question
Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness for procedural fairness; reasonableness for substantive analysis
